Legal_Issue: Whether the Refugee Protection Division erred in rejecting the applicants' claims under sections 96 and 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Assessment: RPD found no nexus to Convention grounds; adequate state protection available in Mexico
Burden_of_Proof: On the claimants to prove nexus to a Convention ground and inadequate state protection
Legal_Rule: Under section 96, nexus to a Convention ground required; under section 97, inadequate state protection must be proven on a balance of probabilities
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of retaliation from drug trafficker for refusing to participate in criminal activities
Key_Evidence_Considered: Applicants' refusal to participate in drug trafficking; availability of state protection in Mexico
Legal_Framework: Refugee law, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Applicant_Challenge: RPD's rejection of refugee claims under sections 96 and 97
Legal_Rule_Source: Sections 96 and 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Legal_Provision: Sections 96, 97, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 96, Section 97, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Persecution due to refusal to engage in drug trafficking
Governing_Rule: Section 96 and 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
